summary: This document is an email chain from February 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing FOIA litigation brought by The New York Times against the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) for records related to Jeffrey Epstein's death. It details the BOP's categorical refusal to release documents, citing multiple FOIA exemptions due to ongoing investigations, and outlines the legal strategy and procedural steps for the government's response.

events.title: BOP Categorical Refusal of FOIA Requests
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons refused to provide any documents in response to The New York Times' FOIA requests regarding Epstein, citing multiple exemptions (5, 6, 7(A), 7(C), 7(E), 7(F)) due to ongoing investigations into his death.

keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons categorically refused to release any documents related to Jeffrey Epstein in response to FOIA requests from The New York Times, citing ongoing investigations into his death.
The government's legal strategy involved defending the BOP's categorical withholdings through agency declarations, with the case proceeding toward summary judgment.

The email chain reveals internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding Touhy requests and FOIA litigation stemming from civil cases related to Epstein.
